review: She treats students like they're kids & is very disrespectful. If you have a question,she will just tell you to read the book. I have graduated from UofT over a year ago, but still remember how amazing this professor is! Very inspirational and truly cares for his students! I still remember many of the things he taught me about virology!

He may not use big words all the time, but he gets his point across, His exams may be hard, but he warns you a long time in advance, STUDY and go to reviews, you will be all set. Probably the best bio prof. on campus.

Dr. Molumby was one of those professors you ether loved or hated. He was extremely caring, helpful and engaging during class. The cons were that his courses were interesting, but hard to prepare for the exams. Better then most though

Here's the truth about Prof. Lyons... If you are a kid that doesn't care and you are just there... He will not help you... But if you care, and strive to do the best... He will help you every step of the way. I used to believe everyone on here about how terrible he is, but really, he's just a hardass. It's tough love imo. One of the best teachers.

The exams are 50 question multiple choice exams. Where about 40 of the questions require you to master every component of what she teaches. She does not teach you the answers during her lectures. And there is too much information to guess which is most important.

This way the best class I took at Maosn. Dr.Bauman has managed to take a subject I thought I hated and make it something fun and interesting. You do need to take good notes and show up to class if you want to do well

All I have to say is ARROGANT!! Also understand the concepts, don't just memorize them. She applies them to everyday situations for the exam questions. All in all, it's a fairly easy class.

Useless is the first word that comes to mind. She is unable to make a answer key for her tests so every exam has to be returned for regarding. Her knowledge is limited to the slides so don't bother asking questions. Her class does make a good nap time if you need a break in your day though

the worst teacher ever, who cares about how the formulas were developed.. TEACH US HOW TO USE THEM! dont take this class if you cant teach yourself some pretty difficult math

good professor. You need to study but lectures are clear and to the point. She is the best at Mason. Take her if you want a good grade, but pay attention and do hw. Don't skip class. Honestly he is the NICEST professor ever, you have to go to class for the journal, 3 tests, 3 quizzes and thats basically it. very easy class, NEED THE BOOK! his lectures are pointless and are not tested on, everything tested on comes from the book, the journal is the only reason you have to go to class; he's so nice though! and old haha

The best prof I've had at UofT! Very funny and his passion for sociology really shows in his lectures. Really made sociology interesting. He gives unclear answers when going over questions so you are left wondering what the right answer is. The comments he makes in class and comments he puts on slides when they are uploaded can be contradictory.  Makes you think in depth about problems.

Great prep. for the MCAT! Uses ingenious problem-based learning and makes you apply all your knowledge. Wants students to get the "whole picture" and genuinely wants you to learn and understand! An outstanding professor.

AMAZING PROFESSOR! He has a bad case of ADD, and he goes on MANY tangents.  He often doesn't tell you the answers to questions because his point is to let you think about the question itself.  Basically the same stuff is covered day after day after day, but if you miss a day, you're screwed because you never know what was discussed the day before.

This professor brings the field of psychology to life. There is a lot of reading and you certainly won't pass if you skip lecture, but she makes it worth it. You'll be excited to go to her lectures, even if you didn't have a prior interest in psychology.
Excellent proffessor. A leader in his field.
The lectures are too easy. (Of course, the tests are not!)

good class, great professor. As long as you focus on what he says during lectures, it's pretty clear cut. He's very conceptual and teaches you the concept, expecting you to be able to apply them. I HATE THIS MAN WITH A FIERY PASSION. He's one of the only 2 people on the planet that I hate. Don't take a class with him. Chances are you won't learn anything and you'll have to take it over.

yeah, i don't agree with most of these people who rated on here--although he may not have a very interesting lecture class, as long as you read the book and listen to what he emphasises in class, YOU WILL DO WELL!! plus, he allows a lot of extra credit!!!

Best professor I've ever had inspired me to be extremly interested in biology. takes time out of his schedule to help students. Before taking Mr. Everett's class, I couldn't stand reading and I couldn't write a decent paper. He taught me how to write well and appreciate reading. I loved that class! He knows what he's talking about and is eager to help when you need it. good class...even better teacher!! Thanks Mr. Everett!

This teacher sucks. All of the bad things mentioned about this dude are true. You can skip all the lectures and teach yourself the material and will be set for the tests. very boring and not clear. did not fare well in his class

She is a good teacher and the class isn't that hard. She even allows the second exam score to count for the first if it helps your grade. Lectures feel short because she's good at teaching.  Going to lecture isn't that important but lab helps a lot.

Tammy is good!!! I never skipped this class. She was able to make people want to participate in a 300 person lecture, that's how good she is. Tells cute stories about her twins. Very clear about material. Encourages questions. Lots of extra credit and ways to get a good grade. Definitely A+!

aw shes such an good teacher. she's sooo clear and understandle and FUN. the classes are so interesting!!! she has made me want to change my major to psychology! take her class for sure.

really nice guy. willing to help if you ask. a little out of his element as far as technology goes, but actually cares about his students.

wonderful, wonderful professor :)

Not an easy A but a likely B.  Definately way easier than any other science gen ed.  Look on the power points to see if there's an in class activity, if there isn't... go back to bed, you'll thank yourself later.  The material is so easy yet she'll trick you on tests but she's nice otherwise.

Oh she is horrible.  She would not give me 0.8% to pass the class....so b/c of that I have to retake it and repay for it.  She is soo unapproachable and very confussing!  I wish there were more MGMT prof's...b/c then I would not have taken her.  And yes her exams are hard. Good luck!

The tests are easy, there is one paper, and tons of extra credit. Go to lab, take the online quizes, and watch the lecture. An 'A' is not difficult to get.

the worse teacher ever!!!  she has such an annoying voice.  she blabbers about irrelevant topics.  she regurgitates the textbook.  her tests are out of nowhere!!! do not take this course!! i stopped going to classes and just taught myself (& did better).

This class covers a lot of material but is enjoyable. To study it's really important you split the content into several days rather than crash the night before. I pretty much memorized the lecture slides and got A's on all her exams. I clickers were easy points and usually occur at the end of each chapter. Put in the work and the grade will follow.
Extremely chill. Fun and cool.

Loves what she teaches, tries to make it fun for all. Work load isnt too heavy, the study guides she gives out for tests tell you everything that might show up on exams. Some don't need the book, but I bought it and it really comes in handy to look stuff up.

this teacher is horible... he stands in front of class and talks for an hour and lookes up at the end of class and asks if anyone has questions and then doesent answer them... he told a student who had a low D that he shouldent drop the corse (this is a few days b4 the late drop period) and said he would be fine... Really great, thorough prof.  He definitely challenges his students with his tests, but his lectures are really clear, and he explains concepts well.  He has a good sense of humour, and throws jokes in now and then to keep class fun.  I've taken two classes with Tepperman.
rude, unclear, boring, pony tail......

Hard class, at least one exam is very hard. Homework 2 is tough. Lecture slides are very good. Be timely and work hard and you have nothing to worry about. I did very well. Does curve so that is nice. Big issues with ML is that he is disconnected from students and students feel very intimidated and tense. He was helpful to me when I made an error.

Tammy is a good prof. her classes are pretty interesting, you can buy the older editions of the textbooks to save money, attendance isn't required but there are random writing assignments assigned in class. Exams are hard but overall good class

Prof is a nice guy but he shouldn't be teaching. His teaching style is random and he does a horrible job of actually explaining the material. DO YOUR SELF A FAVOR AND DROP THIS CLASS ASAP OR ELSE YOUR GONNA SUFFER THROUGH THE SEMESTER

Tammy is the greatest! She is so sweet and she makes the class so interesting. She tells a lot of personal stories to apply the material to the real world. this woman is the best. she makes learning bio so easy. tests are fairly easy, especially because she uses the pyramid system, which means you get to take the test twice and the second time you take it you can use the notes. no homework, plenty of extra credit, and never have to read the textbook. notes are available to print.

Every lecture is on a power point which are uploaded to blackboard before the class starts each day, very easy to follow along, but also very easy to become side tracked as she simply reads from the slides most times.

Well knowledgeable professor. Attend all his lectures if you want an A. Get a hold of recent practice exams, because his old ones are nothing like the actual test. Contrary to what other people say, it isn't impossible to get an A - you just need to put effort. By the way, if you want to score really high on his exams, read the book.

Professor Hylton is a tough professor who doesn't respect her students or the hard work they put into taking this class. I would not recommend her at all. Do not take her!

Randy is a very nice guy, but man is he confusing and loves trick questions. He expects us all to have a biology background, which I did not. The review sessions do not help at all, as he loves trick questions. All True/False. I hated biology before this and now I hate it even more. But he is a good person, just needs to teach more clearly/direct.

I LOVE HIM!! He is such an amazing Prof. He makes me wanna cry (in a good way). I wish there were more of him. I feel privileged to be taking his class and to listen to his lectures. Those who get this opportunity are extremely lucky because it is life changing. I love him to tears. Thank you Professor! I hope you know you are wonderful.

The professor is very clear in her language and is energetic. It helped to see her speak in a positive tone and she gave emphasis on things that was important to remember, which was helpful for studying for the test.

He is nice. But his test are RIDICULOUS. You have to be in his mind set to get the answer right. Read the book, & well just watch out for some questions.. his class is not impossible to pass tho. I ended up with a B.
No Comments
great teacher but it took time to get used to his style of teaching.  people normally adore him or hate his guts
Randall rocks, by far the best teacher I've had so far. I actually thanked him for being such a good teacher when I saw him outside of class. His teaching is clear and entertaining.
Funny and Effective teaching

poor PROFESSOR.  Do not take his class!!!!!!!! If you have to, then sign up for it on SPIRE but just go to another math 127 class because you will probably become dumber from sitting through his lectures.
What really concerned me are the quizzes he assigned. I felt I answered it correctly but was only given partial or no credit. He can be rude to some students. Most of the homework are easy though.

I couldn't agree more with everyone. Simply a phenomenal teacher who connects very well with students. Upbeat, hilarious, and made the material very interesting and easy to understand. Definitely one of the best at UMass and impossible to dislike!
Difficult tests but overall amazing professor. Knows material really well and extremely helpful after lectures.
He's good just go to the SI review sessions, they really help a lot. Hard to pay attention the whole lecture but it is a must if you don't want to get confused.

Just a great professor all around.  You can tell he really enjoys teaching, and knows the material like the back of his hand.  He always has great side stories relevant to the topic to tell; I actually used the other side of my notebook to make notes of just his stories.  He also has his own condensed noteset for the textbook, for free.
Tammy's just the best. She's really funny and has a great grading policy. First thing she told us was that food and drinks were fine in class despite all the signs around the building.
No Comments
A great prof. Good speaker. Fairly easy tests. Really easy final exam. Good course.
No Comments
Mrs. Hylton's acct 361 class is rocks! It is very intersting: that simple. She is the best. Take her if you have a chance.
Has her teaching down to a science. Easy to obtain an A, and provides fun demonstrations in class to keep you interested.

Molumby is a very knowledgeable teacher, however is delivery is confusing at times. His jokes and stories are great, but it's easy to get lost during lectures. Labs and write ups and discussion are easy points. Problems sets kind of bogus, exams are difficult. Getting a C is easy , the challenge is getting an A. Random I-clicker questions too.

He really gets the material across well and is very invested in helping you learn.  If you don't get something, he'll teach it until you get it.  He's also really entertaining for an old dude as well.

You know what you're getting if you take a course with Hylton. I had her for 203 and 301. Neither was easy. In 301 you're gonna have 3 tests make up 95% of your grade.  Other 5% is participation. Doesn't matter, if you don't go to class, you'll fail. Only way you learn the material. STUDY HARD, keep up with text and connect, maybe youll get a B.

Easiest class I've ever taken. If you go to class, do the reading at least sometimes, and study for the test, its a cake walk. There is even a ridiculous amount of extra credit on top of how easy it is. And she drops quizzes and tests, so with a month left in school, I had a A and didn't have to attend anymore. But she's a great teacher so I did!

Passionate teacher, truly loves what she does. Dr. Fondufe puts a fun twist on bio lecture. Be sure to review powerpoints before exams (lowest test is dropped, if final exceeds lowest score) Great base knowledge for upper level biology and chemistry courses.

Go to class, because she gives the type of questions that she is going to put on her exams.  Her tests can be challenging at times, but if you do the hw you will be fine.  Her final is pretty difficult, so make sure you lock down the other exams.
I love randy

This class is a pain! It isn't hard but REALLY tedious. A lot of this stuff I learned in middle school. The professor is EXTREMELY nice but REALLY boring. She reads directly off the slides. Labs are pretty pointless too. If you want an easy science Gen ED this is it- but don't expect to LEARN!
She is simply great. This class is not too easy but it is totally worth to take.
Great prof! He was enthusiastic and explained concepts very clearly. He definitely renewed my interest in chemistry. His mid-term questions were quite reasonable.

Tammy is clearly enthusiastic, and often goes on tangents and supplements the theory with examples from her daily life, which is useful. She will give 'SWAs' which are basically 5 sporadic (but easy) questions about specific case studies to see whether you've read them, but these aren't bad at all. Alwys stays behind after her interactive lectures.
Boring Lectures,

He seems like such a cool person to be friends with but he's not a great lecturer or professor. Very tricky exams. Multiple choice but he gives so many options (A and B; All of the above, A B and C) things like that. It throws a person off because almost all of his questions are like this! If you think you can handle that then take him!

Pay attention to movies, especially what anthropologist related to which movie. Read book or you won't pass. Understand the notes you take because the tests will not be just spitting back the presentations. He will work with you if you make the effort.

im a gov major and this was my first science class and i thought it was extremely easy. i took this in the summer and the hours and labwork were brutal, but as long as u do it she basically gives u 100 on everything. just look at the powerpoints for the tests and u should get an A. i would definitely recommend her if u need to knock out a lab class
Good man. Hellllooooooooo

She is very fun and energetic!! She makes the  material interesting. You must attend class, she keeps track and it will help ur grade. She does not post anything up on Blackboard. Take NOTES!!! The study guides are very helpful and if you dnt know an answer ask her. She will help you. If you study you'll be fine. She's an good prof!!!

Fondufe is a wonderful prof. Lectures are long but thorough and easy to understand. Great at helping and explaining. Material is difficult though, you will have to study for exams. Don't buy the textbook, all powerpoints are posted online and are the source of test material. READ THEM. Occasional iclicker quiz the only reason to attend. Loved her!!
He was really fun to talk to after class.

She teaches directly off the PP, and PP is posted online always. I mainly just study the PP and not the book and still do well on her tests. Her tests are hard if you don't study. Make sure you understand the concepts and not just memorize because she asks very detailed questions in the tests. Overall great teacher!Class average on tests b/w 70-75%

Randy is an good person if you get to know him. If you read the textbook BEFORE the lectures this class will be very easy. I hated being left in the dark about my grades though. Love Randy but I don't know if I'd take his class again.
good prof!

Molumby is a great lecturer and will effortlessly hold your attention throughout the lecture. Exams are all multiple choice and the questions are very tricky. Powerpoints slides are helpful but you do have to read the textbook on your own. Some of the labs are equal to a joke. Easy class if your put the required effort.

Wolf is a nice person but does not know how to teach. Also all the questions come from publisher of the book which makes her lazy. Go to her boring lectures, and take a good note. I had D on 1st test, lower c on the second and pass the class with a B.Make all possible means to go to labs because they are easy points.Katherine Hildebrand is  good TA

She's an good teacher and the best one for Psych 100. Very interesting. As long as you keep up with the reading, study for an hour for the exams, you should get an A. Do the SONA extra credit. It got be from an A- to an A. She drops the lowest exam. Study for the first 3, do extra credit, and SPARK quizzes, and drop exam 4. NO FINAL!

Schurter is actually the best professor I've ever had. He has a genuine interest in his students and really cares about everyone. He makes class interesting and keeps you entertained on what normally would be a dry subject. TAKE JR YEAR WRITING WITH HIM YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT

She is not as bad as everyone says. Accounting is a class that you definitely have to study for. She goes over all the information but I used the book a lot also to help reinforce the lectures. She is not afraid to call you out in class if you are not paying attention but that is just because she wants everyone to pay attention.

Lectures are scattered and pointless. He does not use powerpoint, he just talks and talks and talks. He is very old and his class is boring. If you're going to take him, bring a pillow. Sends out study guides before each quiz and test about the topics on them. That is the only upside to taking his class. Read the book, don't listen to him.

This is the type of class where you have to read the book and do all of the assigned hw problems to really grasp the concepts of accounting. I think the book is  very well written as well. Mrs. Hylton expects her students to do the assigned hw so that the lectures will simply be a review for them.

see a lot of comments here about "Easy A's." If that's what you are looking for, go to some sleazy online money trap and buy yourself a degree. If you want to learn about composition, writing, and literature FOR REAL then take his classes. He loves what he does (for real!) and respects those that want to learn.

straight foward class, no tricks, not hard but not easy, one of those gotto go through the motions to get the degree classes like SOM 301, 99% of the work is in lab and thats easy as long as u show up, but felt like she was just waiting for me to cheat on something and theres no need in this class
He is really fare in person, but he is certainly out to get you on the exams.  If you email him and tell him you need a certain grade for your major he will reconsider you grade.

She's good, definitely makes the worth going to. The class is super fun, can get difficult, but if you go to class, take notes, pay attention, and study you will get an A. Take her class! Don't buy the textbook... if you're into textbooks just rent it. I rented mine, didn't use it once.
This guy is unintelligible.  I actually think I'm getting WORSE at calculus.  His tests are TERRIBLE.  Thank god for the TAs, or everyone would flunk.
Most defiantly a morning person.

He writes EVERYTHING (yes everything) down, so its confusing while taking notes.  Calc isn't that easy anyway, but they do scale the tests. Youll need a tutor or study session for this class. Dont rely on lecture alone. I dont remember using the book alot
A good professor who has good intentions. His age does make it a little harder to understand but he knows his stuff and if you aren't retarded you will do fine.
He's funny but his questions are confusing...I loved Chemistry in grade 12 and 11 got very high marks but in Uni my mark dropped not by a grade but really low and now my marks made me hate chemistry
Mostly a very interesting lecturer, can drone on at times. Very interesting presentation of course material, but know your stuff!The tests are ridiculous!

She is THE best Bio teacher I could have had first semester at UMass. Looked forward to her class, she genuinely cares about making us understand. She is frickin hilarious and gives you absolutely every chance possible to get an A. She's not even 5 feet tall yet she has the respect of 99% of people in the room...that says a lot!

Professor Goodenough is an INCREDIBLE professor - she is clear, funny, and completely modest. She truly cares about her students and wants everyone to do well. The way the class is set up makes it virtually impossible not to get an A. She is kind and her exams are a breeze. She manages to make BIO fun-also tons of extra credit! Take this class!!!
Great professor, best 100 class. go to class, read the book, do homeework, extra credit... EASY A

I highly recommend this class for a gen ed! She is hilarious and the class is all about sex and stds, it's really interesting to follow along. She does great demonstrations and is a really nice lady. There are 3 tests and one is dropped, and optional term paper to boost your grade. She also gives lots of extra credit! this was my favorite class
harder tests

She's very fair. Her lecture's were good and also attendance is optional. Her tests are very fair and she tells you exactly what will be on them, you just have to study. The HW/Quizzes were very easy. She even made a second grading scale that made the final worth more to give you a chance to recover with a good final grade. I liked her a lot

Calc 2 is not an easy subject therefore it is important to look for extra help. you cannot expect to do well by simply showing up to class and taking notes. The math help center is good for reinforcement and Prof Cook is usually available whenever you would like to schedule an appointment.
Too much reading for a half-year. Test prtty detailed; ask for numbers in table.

Very knowledgeable prof - its obvious he's been teaching the material for some time. At first I didn't like him at all, but he grew on me. I'm guilty of occasionally falling asleep in class but considering it's not his job to teach us how to pay attention he is an excellent prof. tests are fair, no tricks, straight from lecture. just gotta study

Fondufe was a very charismatic, passionate professor who clearly cares about all of her students. iClicker quizzes are pop quizzes so make sure to bring your clicker with you every class, tests are based off the powerpoints, lectures can get dry but this is due to the material itself (not the prof.). Overall, a clear-cut course and fun professor.

He is a very very nice guy, cares for his students but you will have to make all the effort for any help you want, and if you want an A be ready to do a lot of work and learning yourself because his lectures will not get you an A on the exams, which tend to be very tricky.

She likes to hear herself talk. DONOT TAKE WITH HER. They make everyone take the final even though its optional because they wont release your exam 3 grades until after. Have to buy her book and notes so its 300 for loose leaf paper. AVOID

He's all over the place in lectures and often does out long complicated problems on the board and only mentions when he's finished that it won't be on the test and he just wanted to show us where things come from. He doesn't explain what he's teaching--just scribbles on the board without explaining. Go to TA led review sessions--they will save you!

This was the easiest class ever. If you need a BS for one of your gen eds take this class. At first I went to every class, but thats not necessary. Just read the packet of notes and take the practice test and you should be fine. I got over a 90 on each exam. She also offers so much extra credit that I ended   up with over a 100 average in the class
Goes off tangents. a lot. exams are hard. not helpful at all. avoid him if you can.

He is passionate about literature and gives his students a lot of tools to utilize in order to excel in the class. He is also articulate and intelligent. I would highly recommend him to anyone who needs a literature class.
if he wrote the text, why is he UNABLE to speak without notes? lectures=text

Molumby is good! And yes I think he's hot - he likes heavy metal and beer and bees and he talks about them often but he's interesting and makes going to class worth it. Exams, however, were pretty brutal, so study everything! :-/

I believe myself to be a  reasonable student and I do not know why he is allowed to teach Anthro. I am not failing his class, however,  his tests are as if he purposely wants to bring your grades down. In the beginning of his class he almost bragged about his classes usually having a low C average. He is not helpful and his work is unnecessary.

i really didn't have as hard of a time with this guy as a lot of other people seem to, i just found him to be very awkward. he did seem to make an effort to take and answer questions, but it was a very large class and i guess he felt he had to move on. not a great explainer but read the book, do the hw, you will be ok. i barely went and got an A-.

Taking this class was the worst idea I have ever had. This class makes me wants to drop out of college and being my career over again at another institution. He is the worst professor I have ever had the unfortunate time to meet.
She's a very amusing professor, but dispenses alot of the same information over and over again...kind of tedious. As long as you go to class once and awhile, you shouldn't have trouble.

She goes through the powerpoint slides without doing a good job at explaining the material. So, you have to do a lot of the learning on your own by reading the text. Coming to class was kinda useless, but sometimes she tells news stories or anecdotes and puts one or two questions on the exam about it. Exams are straightforward.

i hate him his comments are not constructive feedback just plain rude and not helpful. Its his way or NO WAY! he only likes one style writing (elementary short sentences) and if you do write in a scholarly manner than you r pretty much SCREWED! hes rude, obnoxious and biased. AVOID HIM!

This is an easy, straightforward course as long as you stay awake during lectures. Brym is an extremely boring professor whose unfounded arrogance is sometimes appalling. However, the course material is easy to master. Textbook readings are key; Brym follows them closely during his lecture. All in all, its a course that isn't difficult.
Pretty easy and fair class. Her study guides are extremely long though and there are a lot of material on the tests but they are not bad if you study. Do not need to get the textbook.
Good as a person. Not good as a instructer

i took calc in hs, and like math, i found the class to be easy, but only cus i had an understanding in calc, i do not recomend cook and from what i heard about the other math teachers i dont recomend them either, cook is boring, old and doesnt teach, wish i could say something good, but nothing comes to mind
He was really amazing, caring, and inspirational.
Excellent. It does get a little boring after sitting in the lecture for two hours but overall one of the better professors.

Very nice man but senile.  There are always problems with his exams once we go over them as a class.  Students have literally brought the textbook out and said "I put ____ as an answer because it is in the textbook and you marked it wrong" but for Professor Dennis, it is his way or nothing.  VERY frusterating.
you don't even have to go to class.  EASY
Excellent and intelligent Professor. He is so clear during his lectures. Though Chemistry is not interesting, but he made it interesting.

Tough grader.  She likes to take points off for everything.  Even if you do the homework right, you'll lose points for layout or something.  Be careful to never use or look at any access database that is not yours.  She accuses a lot of students of cheating even when they haven't.

He's a nice guy with a great sense of humor but his tests are hard...and he asks about questions like, what mating system do the Lake Erie water-snakes exhibit? - if you didn't read those 2 sentences from a specific chapter in the book then you're going to get the question wrong.

He is such a sweet man. His lectures were long and boring. I stopped attending after first exam. 3 exams, 3 quizzes all very easy if you read the book and truly understand. He gives a study guide but its very useless for his exam. He gives plenty extra credit and opportunity to pass. Would definitely take again.

i used to love math. i was really good at it.....but then i took this class...he writes down EVERY word he says and the class does absolutely nothing. I don't go to class at all anymore because if i do i just do sudoku or fall asleep...there is just no use anymore i would rather sleep an extra hour than go all across campus to the worst class ever!

The good: lectures are over quickly. The bad: lectures are over quickly. They usually end early, but you may not learn much. Most people (at least me) learned most of the stuff during the RCT, which were VERY helpful. The book helps out too. Quizzes and tests reflect the lectures, and tests are MC. Not the best prof. at GMU, but you'll be fine.
I am not a mean person but I can't help yelling that she SUCKS
Excellent prof, and the tests are easy if you study
Very nice person, will help you whenever you go to him. Makes class fun.
superb prof. easy going, very stylish

I totally don't understand why he is so hot on "rate my professor". Actually he is so terriable at teaching. Not half of the class will go to his lecture now. He teaches us nothing!! If the level of understanding of a concept is 10, he is teaching us negative 2! Worst prof ever. Don't like him.

Fondufe is the absolute best! Biology has never been my strongest subject, but she is so passionate about science and gives clear and effective analogies to help reinforce each subject. She's approachable and clearly very knowledgable about what she teaches. I would definitely recommend her, whether you're taking bio for a gen ed or a major req.
She is the absolute best teacher in the Crim department. I wish she taught every class! Now if you want to actually learn and have fun learning, she is definitely the one to take!!!!!
good prof, hes hilarious
She didn't help at all. She reads straight off from the powerpoint. Most of the time, I had to learn everything all by myself. Her exams are really hard. I wish I didn't pick her as my professor.
I really liked the course I had with him and I found his lectures clear and easy to follow. I liked his style of teaching as well... overall very good prof and course!
He's BORING and CHILDISH
good teacher, easy, tests aren't too hard

she's an easy teacher...she wanted us to learn the greek alphabet and we asked her if we could learn it for extra credit and she agreed. She's cool, not a hard class at all...no tests all papers and no final or midterm :)

Dr. Bauman is the best professor on the face of the earth! I loved her class so much, I'm taking her ARTH 360 class in the fall. I thought art history would be boring, but she made me love it. If you want an easy and fun way to fulfill your fine art requirement, take her! She's great. =]

Terrible professor. I was making 5's on my developmental essays and as soon as I got into this class I failed every one of his essay's. Very confusing teacher, does not break things down and was terrible with communication. VERY HARD. The WORST professor I HAVE EVER HAD. NEVER take this class with him. poor experience!

I enjoyed every minute I spent in this class. She encourages class participation but creates an atmosphere where you feel comfortable doing so. Grade is based on 4 exams, but one grade is dropped, and homework that is very manageable. Fantastic class with a fantastic professor.

Such a cool guy. He once told are class to sit in a dark room with our friends and talk about death. Lectures are interesting but the material can be challenging. He does post old exams to study from and reuses some questions but be careful because he'll reword them slightly to throw you off

She is easily the worst teacher I have ever had and that is saying a lot.  Would not help you at all during class if you got stuck.  Would literally yell at you to "figure it out" if you asked a question.  The textbook is beyond useless and it took real world experience for me to figure out why I had to take this class.  Avoid her at all costs.
monotonous, no clarity
good prof. not a bad person in person. his classes are hard but he does know his stuff. he is mean to the class but once you talk to him one on one with questions he will answer and explain it.

She has lecture notes written in which you have to fill in for every lecture, so you have to go to class every time. Her exams are mainly focused on class activities/videos. Her hw was fairly easy and helpful. Discussion available for 20 extra points.

He is completely rude to his students. Makes comments that "he is disappointed" in the grades, and "if you received below a certain grade don't bother showing up for the test, send someone else". Frequently say's "If you don't like it, I don't care". Lectures are CONFUSING! Book he authored IS HORRIBLE (so many mistakes). AVOID!!

A very enthusiastic teacher that keeps course material interesting.  Tends to cover the basic concepts in class but not the details needed to well.  I did well by reading ahead of class and only going to classes when I felt like it.
Horrible. Avoid this class unless you have extra time to go to tutoring where you can actually learn something or if you can afford a zero figured in to your GPA.
Incredibly funny and easy to understand. Lectures are fun and go by in an instance. Drops a ton of grades. Easy A!

I enjoyed working with Mr. Everett.  His essays were very difficult for me.  He is available for assistance during his office hours.  I recommend taking advantage of his help if English is not your forte.  As long as you attend class, do your best on the assignments, and complete the assigned readings for quizzes you should pass.

for 128, cook does a decent job covering the material considering that it's a hard subject. much better than 127 with Rudvalis. sometimes difficult to see what it is he is talking about, but he will try and clarify if you ask him. I suggest going to the math help center, they take everything he sais in class and makes it easy to understand.
Prof Brym is the best prof at U of T

I Absolutley looovveee this Professor. She is very helpful with assignments and understands that her class is not the most important one we are taking for the semester. She gives plenty of helpful hints for upcoming quizzes and exams and makes every class period the most enjoyable i have ever had in my whole college experience. I HIGHLY recommend:)

this was hard cuz it was purely memory work.  rather than regurgitating his notes, he could have organized it in a more pedagogical manner... easier to generalize somehow.  his notes could use index or something.

This class can be difficult.  The grading criteria is straight forward. The final exam was very challenging but not too challenging that it was not passable. If you show up each week for the lecture, do the homework due for recitation, as well as the online portions you will get a good grade. You can always visit the accounting lab for extra help.
Cool teacher, test questios are overly confusing, but you learn what you need to know.
No Comments

Lyons gets a bad rap, but he is just the no non-sense type of professor. His default is treat everyone as a threat to course. But after he has made his direction for the class clear and everyone is on the same page things will improve. His assignments are not given to confuse students, but rather to teach them. His study guides are just everything.

Really easy class.  Went like twice and didn't even need to.  As long as you study the notes before the test you should be fine.  She added a weekly homework component, but it's really easy and takes like 2 seconds to do.  You only need a 90 average to get an A, so there's really no excuse to get any less than that.

I've gone to almost every class, sat in the front. Tried to pay attention to his lectures and I have yet to learn a single thing from this dude. He goes on random tangents about unrelated stuff and somehow it ends up on the test. His labs are easy and there is almost no homework in the class  but his lectures are a complete waste of time.

He's a nice guy but his lectures are all over the place and he seems to not know what he's talking about. His lectures are VERY unhelpful. If yoo've had clac before he's ok but if it's your first time taking calc avoid him at all costs.

Professor Christopher is amazing! She cares about her students success, and tries to connect the lectures to her life experiences which makes things fun to learn and easier to grasp. She's the reason I changed my major from business to crim and I suggest everyone to take all her classes. Take her class you will have fun and won't regret it!
He is HILARIOUS the only reason i showed up to school is cuz i wanted to come to his lectures seriously he will make you laugh the whole lecture. good!!!
Should not teach intro bio, would be better at higher level courses.

Hes rough but overall not as bad as people say. Just do the work study for the test overall its supposed be to a hard class. Will take attendence from time to time. Pop quizes are ridiculous but hey what can you do! JUST STUDY

read the textbook!!!!!!!!!!!!! his tests are hard but not totally impossible...this course is a difficult first year course that i recommend to those who are willing to work very hard! overall grade for Prof Brym: C

Read the assigned reading ahead of time! Yes, it's hard but that's college. I heard so many people complain about him being impossible to pass, it's not impossible if you do what your supposed to. Definitely not an easy A, but there is not much work. Read chapters, a couple of online quizzes, handful of tests, final is open notebook.

This professor is very nice, but class is a big waste of time.  He gives the students the floor for half of the class to discuss whatever they want on certain topics/issues.  Some students may enjoy this, but I'd rather use that time at home to study for my other classes.  As long as you get the books and complete the study guides, you'll do well.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS! This class is by far the WORST class Ive ever taken at UMASS. He doesnt reply emails or put anything on Moodle. Lectures are the WORST in the entire universe and are useless. You really learn nothing but are required to know a ton of BS for the midterms. Its quite lovely... Dont take this class if you value your GPA!
he is a horrible teacher...he knows the information but doesnt clarify it, never organized, always late, the test are WICKED HARD and TRICKY!! i hated that class!!

Dennis is one of the nicest professors I have ever had.  He is a bit confusing at times, but what professor isn't.  He is lighthearted and doesn't intimidate his students.  I would recommend him to anyone who asked.

Putting in more work does not always equate to a better grade, Molumby.. He likes to quip that if you are not getting the grade you want, you are not working hard enough. Know the phrase work smarter not harder? Where things pay off is being able to digest, comprehend, and recall the concepts learned in lecture, lab, book, and probs. Review often.
Has her own crazy agenda for the class, unlike any other phl 100 class I've heard of.  Paper assignments are very vague, and hard to understand exactly what she wants from them.
I thank God each class for my laptop or I'd die.
She's an absolute 100% <Insert assorted cuss words here>

I only missed one point out of all assignments/labs. that part was easy.  the tests, however...RIDICULOUS. he throws random facts in there and makes it way harder than the class actually is.  im a soph with a 3.9 and find classes that should be more challenging way easier than his class bc of his unfair tests. if i get a B in this class its such BS

Dr. Sacher is a wonderful professor!  She is organized and her assignments are fun and relevant.  Going to class was like getting free therapy!
Was a great teacher and I understood all of the concepts that he taught. He makes sure that the class is engaged in the lecture. He does have hard tests though..
Makes class interesting and fun

She got sucky towards the end. She started strong and gave good lectures, but towards the end of the year she started to drag onnnn everything. She is def. not hard to listen to, and her exams are really not that hard as long as you keep up in lab and read her slides. Pretty straight-forward.

Cook is a nice and funny guy, but his teaching can come up a little short. Goes off on tangents frequently and explains things a little more difficult than they have to be. I thought the material would be super easy since the first thing we did was antiderivatives for a good 2 weeks, but then ramped it up and it got very hard. The TA taught better.
he's very clear, entertaining (with prim gestures) and SO SEXY!!!

she does the best she can in a gen. ed. science class of more than 250 people. she wants everyone to do well, but it is hard to personally help that many people. i learned alot from her. you have to study hard for the tests and ace lab.

Prof. Browning is definitely not "plain old vanilla." Must say, fantastic prof, fair tests that really reflect your knowledge, etc. Definitely my favourite chem prof ever. But he looks like George McFly from Back to the Future, end of story.

The class itself is very easy, but I don't understand why we need someone to read the PPT slides. This is almost a self-study course. She tends to pass her responsibilities to someone else such as lab instructors and other directors. It seems like she has no responsibility at all.

Attendance isn't mandatory but she does not post to Blackboard so GO TO CLASS. I'd never taken an art class in my life but still managed A's on every exam. Such a great professor! Truely one of my favorites. Class was entertaining and tests were easy if you study the notes. Book isn't really necessary. Overall, easy A and a great class

for a 9am class, susan kept it entertaining because she's slightly crazy, has a ton of energy, and is passionate about psych. she is a really good teacher & very well prepared for class. the class is pretty easy although you do have to attend because her exams are mostly all about the stuff she goes over in class,not from the book. i recommend her

you MUST take at least one class with her. its just worth it.

LOVED this class. take him for anth 045, it's the easiest class he teaches and you will love him for it. he is absolutely hilarious and makes you never want to miss a minute of his class. grade is based on only 4 tests (directly from study guide) and obviously if you don't go to class or read the book you won't do well. doesn't take attendance

Hard exam and tests!
good professor, the class is a lot of fun!!

Excellent biology teacher! Her exams are easy and if you pay attention, you'll pass.

Professor Bauman is a great professor. She lets you know from the start how she wants things, and how the course will be. great prof. probably one of the best courses at u of t. brym is one of the best public speakers i've known. the course is easy to do well in as long as you do the readings.

Should've passes on this class. Terrible. Did not learn anything. He graded on a downward scale. RUN!

I happen to know some high level folks (guess who) at SRA and other major industry partners, who would be mighty displeased with the current direction of the courses offered by the individual in question. Have a great day!

Amazing teacher. She somehow made Art History seem important, which is rather impressive. I know nothing about art, but she made the class fun, interesting, important, and even relevent. Some really dry assigned readings, but she makes up for it with her lectures. Take her!
i took this class over the summer, and LOVED her teaching style. She is very animated and keeps you interested. Besides, her notes are extremely comprehensive and her tests are fair.

Hard class in general but you can understand what he is saying. Hes the better teacher out of the 2 professors that teach this class. Hes funny because he curses alot in class. overrated.  picks favorites, doesn't give off a genuine, kind vibe.

Randy is the best professor I have ever had.

Human Biology is super easy. If you go to every class and pay attention you shouldn't have to study or read the textbook. She's great. I don't understand why anyone would say she is boring or hard on grading. I love this class. It's interesting, very fair, and I don't know of anyone in the class who doesn't participate or who doesn't like the class. She's one of my favorite professors

Dr. Wolf's lecture is pretty easy and clear.Her exmas are easy, and the text is easy as well.Compared to other SOM classes, her class is doable. I liked the book....it's just simple and doesn't confuse people.

DO NOT TAKE - absolutly avoid at all cost. Will not teach you - will try to "get you" - loves going to board meetings - have a feeling that she hates everyone and wants them to fail. If you ever get a chance to take Prof Bauman DO IT!  She is one of the best professors that I have ever had at George Mason!  Her lectures can get a little long but she's a little ball of fire!  Amazing woman!  AMAZING!

very interesting lectures, however he can be bias at times

One of my favorite Prof's at UofT. Great pace, passion for what he does, easily approachable, but the tests he writes are undoubtedly the hardest out of all 1st year profs.

i loved her! she's a really good teacher. if you google her class and her name you can find all the powerpoints filled in so you dont always have to go to lecture. kind of a boring class but she's so nice.

shes good!!!! not only does she dress wicked cute but class is very interesting as well. there is also a lot of extra credit which is great. A++

Great class if you are into art history. But be warned, it is a hard classs. I got an A but had to study my a** off. Also, she does not grade any of the tests herself. Her assistant does, and makes a ton of mistakes. Check your test twice and go see her.

I learned a lot. Don't expect this to be a blow-off class though. Attend class and participate in discussion and she will like you. She can be sarcastic but it's funny. Literally, if you study her power-points, you will get an A. i skipped almost all of her classes, and aced her tests. just do her study guides and her power points has so much information, you are bound to get an A.
