This guy actually wants you to fail.  Avoid him like the plague

One of the best profs i've had. You read an article that you think is really uninteresting and he talks about it in class and brings it to life making you understand it in a whole new way. Sooo helpful. Really wants you to succeed. Takes a genuine interest in his students. Such a great guy. Clearly loves what he does and this passion is contagious.
tests r crazy
although very funny, he did not fully explained things clearly. should have given more examples in class
Great class! 3 exams and an optional final. HW is easy and helps out the grade alot as well. Great class to take as an elective for psych majors.
The class is ok, she takes it very serious.  Quiz everyday and attendance is important.  Two 8 pages papers make up most of your final grade.
Dont take his course.  He is the worst professor in the world. Teaches useless stuff.  Unfair grading policy, difficult tests
1st exam  95, 2nd exam 87, 3rd exam 74, final exam, 55, Connects hw and quizzes 8. Final exam was excessively difficult. Do not take her if you don't have enough time to study literally by yourself.
People are so bad at math. Thurlow is a decent teacher and so funny

Sweet mother of God is this man over his head. He has no idea how to instruct a course properly. He is a bad lecturer and an even worse person. As others have said he is demeaning to students and overall rude. He is uninformed on the subject matter and lacks proper interactive skills a professor needs to be successful. Avoid at all costs.
she is very funny and class is interesting
amazing prof.

Probably one of the worst Bio instructors I've had. Attending lectures is pointless as I didn't learn a single thing from listening to his rambling. The book is useless. For tests, he expects you to know every single example on his 200+ slides. Only way to "study" is memorize the answers to the previous exams and hope they actually show up on tests

One of the best profs at U of T. He really cares about his students. If you work hard you can easily get over 80 in this course because it is not difficult to understand and Dr. AbouHaidar makes it very interesting making you want to learn more. People with neg feedback are bitter because they tried to bs the exam and it backfired on them.

Okay, here's the deal with Cook.  His class seems harder than it is because he goes on long rants about how to derive equations.  You DO NOT need to understand exactly how to do this, all you need to write down is the final equation that he derives, and understand when to use it.  If you memorize and understand these few equations, then tests are s
All of his lectures are really common sense. I don't understand why he creates his tests so confusing eventhough stuffs he knows truly lacks novelty...
He's a really sweet guy.  Pretty boring, but worth going to class.  No papers or homework, fairly easy tests, make sure you check his math though!

She's a great professor. Took her in the morning and it was easy to pay attention in class because she's hilarious. Make sure you read through the textbook because she gives out pop quizzes from the book.
BOOOOOOOOOORRRRRRRRRIIIIIIIINNNNNNNNNNNGGGGGGGGGGG!

She's not a bad professor, per se, but she's simply not a very interesting person. If you're a frat boy/sorority girl, she is the professor for you. She's conventional in her attitude and the work won't challenge you at all.
He isn't a bad teacher, but he needs more expression in his voice! He helps out students during lab time which is nice!
she was great - easy homework (and not much of it) and her exams were really straight forward. easy A, and interesting too.

Goodenough is very clear and precise about the material and presents it in an interesting way. She's lenient and willing to help you out. Tests are easy if you come to lecture and study the notes she gives out.

Alexander used a free "book" which you could pretty much study and not have to go to class. But, he always had interesting stories and kept class pretty interesting. Tests were not very hard, very few homeworks, and attendance was not required.

Great Professor! She is a smart woman who really knows what she is talking about.  She is someone that I really admire in the Accouting Department.  If you have any questions she or your lab instructor are always there for help.

poor. Doesn't help, isn't interested, doesn't have clear understanding of subject matter. Condescending, spiteful, lazy. The plus side: ends class usually an hour early, no doubt because glossing over ppt slides she doesn't understand has come to an end.
run as fast as you can in the other direction. his lectures have nothing to do with the tests, but then again neither do his study guides.

people confuse his great personality with his ability to teach. "Flies" through 40 slides in less than 2 minutes with minimum description.  great person to have around to present as a guest lecturer, not so much if you who is actually able to teach you something

Randy is a great professor who really cares about his students. He will do everything in his power to make sure you succeed. YOU MUST ATTEND LECTURE. Seriously if you just look at his slides and don't attend lecture all you'll find is a bunch of pictures  that make absolutely no sense. Study for Friday quizzes and exams a lot and you'll get the A.
JAR OF PEPPERS!

Molumby is a super cool dude who can be intimidating at first. He's super funny in class and when you go into office hours he's more than happy to have you. Usually the question you ask ends up on the exam so it's a bonus. Practice exams are online and super helpful. Taking AP Bio before this class also makes it very easy to understand.

Great Teacher. He focuses more on concept than memorization he's a great guy, really wants us to learn. Reading the book will greatly increase ur level of understanding of the material but if u go to class and review sessions you should still do well. Material is somewhat confusing but he tries to explain until u get it.

Dr. Sacher is a sweet professor, very understanding.  Although there is much work to be done for this research class she does her best to guide you thru the entire process.  I dont have my grade yet, but I'm pleased with her class you learn alot. There is a large paper due but it is done with a group.  Make sure you choose your group member wisely.

She is limited to her slides and stupid movie clips.  Ever hear of doing actual examples, maybe have practice quizzes in class.  She is just lazy... I got a B and it was ok... But I think her teaching sucks as does she.

His classes should be labeled for English majors. Papers are graded harshly. Even more so if it strays from his interpretation of the writings. Listen to everything thing he says about a story or poem so you can essential reword it if you hope to get top marks.
good teacher. Reuses tests, so STUDY the old ones that are online. Definitely keeps your interest, pretty funny guy. Plus, he's got a sweet beard.

Ever1 told me not to take her bc she's hard, but it's not true. It all depends on your study habits. She moves very quickly bc she's from NY :) but if you sit up front and pay attention, you will understand the material and learn to love it. She's challenging!

She is a great professor, but the class content is blatantly obvious BS!  No problem with her, but more the SOM for making us take this class... Example of course content: when you are mad, you might take it out on other people...DUH    Motivated people are better employees... DUH    People dont like to be looked down upon... DUH

Prof Phillis is a good teacher if you already have a strong background in biology. His tests are very difficult and the discussion sections almost useless. There is no way to know how you are doing in the class until the very end. I hear SI sections are helpful. the only real plus side to this class is that there is no homework
good teacher

he likes to blabber about random things and then chuckle at his own jokes. Seems like a nice guy, but doesnt do a good job of staying on task with his teaching. He is often late and always has problems with the microphone. His tests are badly worded.

A great professor that gives interesting lectures and prepares you well for exams. You have to go to class due to clicker questions (although since his lectures are interesting this shouldn't be an issue) His tests are somewhat hard but go to SI sessions and you should be fine. Don't bother buying the textbook as its never used. Better than others.
Funny.  Intelligent.  Cute.  Great teacher.  What more can you ask for?
Very hard course

She makes this class so entertaining. Tammy is a funny lady and her class is easy. Tests posed more of a challenge than you's think but she drops the lowest one. Just a fun class to go to and interesting things to learn about. Probably the best gen ed class I've taken in my 3 years here.
I question her neutrality
this guy is hard...i dont know why he makes his exam retakes impossible since your maximum grade on the retakes are capped.

He jumps into examples and never tells us how he got there. some things he teaches in class arent in the book so theres no way to study some of it, and before the final he tries to teach us new stuff whispering all throughout (cold) and there was 2 pages of that on the exam. i am premed, and because of his work, i am now at a major disadvantage.
Just don't ever take a class from this man if you can avoid it.  Do yourself a favor.

Michael is one of my best friends. He takes the time to get to know you, mainly through knowing your resume, and will give you feedback based on your aspirations. Is incredibly cultured and knowledgeable on everything. Highly recommend talking to him in office hours just because of how great of a guy he is.

I thought Molumby was a great professor. Unlike many professors, he managed to hold my attention during lectures. My only issue was that his exams covered stupid details from lectures instead of major topics. It was like he was testing us on our attendance instead of our understanding of the topic. He gives a great curve at the end!
WORST PROFESSOR IN THE WORLD!!!!  Avoid her AT ALL COSTS. Enough said.

browning is the hottest piece of ass to walk into lash miller. on a side note, his lectures weren't bad either. i like the way he sips his water, puts his hands through his hair and the unintentional sexual innuendos placed everywhere.
constant mistakes makes it hard to follow him, high school methods i dont even remember seem to work better than he technical mumbo jumbo ways of solving should be simple problems.

Horrendous teacher, is too busy yelling/chasing people for walking out of class (not what I paid for), and clucks/pecks like a chicken when she talks.  I'm getting a B, and have worked way too hard for it. If you can, AVOID AVOID AVOID, you will hate ACCT after her.

The courses he teaches are the easiest calcs offered at UMass. If you don't do well on his course, even if you were without an instructor, you are a god damn shame. This course is a high school-repeat. Cook's understanding in Math is very profound. He's humble and also a great resource. I would highly question the work ethic of those who complain.

People who complain about the difficulty of the course just need to put in more work. He's an extremely helpful, friendly professor who is deeply passionate about the material, so of course he wants to go into detail. It doesn't hurt that he has a great sense of humor too, it really brightens up the class.
She is a great teacher, However accounting is a hard subject so you have to study a lot to do well. I am taking her again for account 301 beacuse I think she is an good teacher
She is an good teacher.Very funny and keeps the class entertaining. TAKE HER I HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO EVERYONE.
No Comments
He is a very nice man, but his lectures are very scattered.  The material we go over is useless. He always uses poweroints and he swiftly goes through the slides so no one can copy the notes.
No Comments

Terrible teacher, extremely boring...he writes down EVERY word he says in paragraph form.  Doesn't show many examples and doesn't explain things well at all.  I took AP Calc in highschool and I still didnt understand the way he taught the material...unless you have taken Calc before, you're basically screwed in his class.

I thought Art History was going to suck but Professor Baumen was good!  I have never skipped a class and I rarely find myself daydreaming. She makes the class interesting. The Papers are easy if you go to lectures and midterm and final are not that hard if you study.

The best professor that Ive had. Her class is extremely entertaining and she is really helpful. 4 tests which arent terribly hard and you get to drop one of them. No final. Quizzes are all online so you can do them with a group. Her lectures are really fun and entertaining. She gives pop writings but they arent hard as long as you read

The second exam was, for the most part, supposed to be based on genetics and evolution. Please tell me why my version of the exam was about 5% genetics and 95% information related to very specific information from exam 1 information. I understand that we should know exam 1 info, but I literally just studied your 1000 ppt slides for nothing...

Prof. Lyons is the ONLY teacher at Mason that I ever really learned anything from. Yes he is abrasive and hard to approach but his lectures are interesting and jokes are funny. He grades tough and hates stupid questions but that is only because he actually expects you to put some effort into the course. If you take that initiative you will do fine.

Professor Schurter is probably the best teacher I have had at UMass. He really gets his student's business writing materials in great working order for the real world. He also educates his students on how to be good people. Wish i could take this class over again. Class is mandatory, no textbook needed.

Absent from class for nearly two months. Learned a lot, but on my own initiative. Takes weeks to respond to questions and grade assignments. Prescribes thousands of pages of reading in total: two textbooks, online modules, online reserved readings, and Web material. Combined with homework, it is entirely too much work in this class.

Hard class in general but if you read the text book and do the homework you will get an A. She tells you exactly what will be on it. I never went to recitation but I did the connect homework and got an A. Never had above an 86 on my tests and got an 89 on the final. Ended up with an A, will push up your grade if she sees that you tried on the final
you have to read lots to get good marks!
very nice and helpful! just love this class :)
Soc 101ers have Prof Tepperman wrong. He is a wonderful and smart prof.
worst prof ever and extremley dry. He acts very cocky and he has no time for any questions or extra help.
Very cool
Great lecturer! Although he has some weird obsession with eigenfunctions...

This class consisted of 4 exams, 3 tests worth total 60 percent of your grade, and 1 final worth 30 percent, last 10 percent come from your connect hw and quizzes. The professor was not really helpful, mostly I studied by watching online videos. The final was the hardest, other 3 tests was ok, most questions came from connect hw and quizzes.

He tends to go off on tangents and not fully cover the material. The labs are mind numbing but nothing too bad. The tests are hard. Even after reading and trying to memorize literally hundreds of slides it still feels like he uses questions from the top of his head and not actual material. Good guy but overall a bad teacher.

This is a hard class! dont think its an easy A, at all!! I found her to be interesting, but the exams are no joke. Go to every class, and write down everything. I mean everything. If you like art, you will enjoy, if not, look else where. She is tough.
Can't teach at all!

Hard teacher. Blame the department for the hard tests but practice tests are nothing like the real ones. Class is so boring i've might lost attention numerous times every class. Nothing came clear to me any classes. AVOID HIM

Lyons gets a bad rap but I thought his 366 course was enjoyable. He provides very detailed lectures (sometimes too detailed) but if you pay attention you will learn the material. The exams are more difficult than the study guides entail, but if you take notes during the lecture on what he talks about in relation to the topics, you'll be okay.

He goes off in tangents.  He never solved problems completely out and he'd derive some equations and confuse you so much.  The lectures, OWLs, won't prepare you for the test. I got more help at the tutoring places than going to lecture all semester. But he's a nice guy though.

Took her for an internship summer course.  No grading criteria, expectations or rubric whatsoever -- no explanation for the grade until everything is submitted.  Her research paper had 2 sentences of vague instructions and expectations.  Did not know what she wanted in the assignment.  Not helpful on email at all.  DO NOT TAKE!!!

He is enthusiastic and shows that he loves what he does. He asks vague questions in class to get discussions going.  He might not be very clear in class with everything, but he offers study sessions every Thursday, and then adds Tuesdays when it gets closer to the Final. He gives you every opportunity to understand the material and ask questions.
Professor Brym makes my day!!!!!!!!!
A nice guy, but a blah professor.

Prof. Hylton isn't as bad as everyone says she is. If you ask her questions she helps you and responds quick to emails. Attendance is not required but she tells you what to study in class for the exams except the Final is quit tough. As long as you attend class, do the connect homework and quizzes and practice them a lot for the exams you'll pass.
She is amazing at answering questions and emails! utilize her intelligence and helpfulness. also makes some hilarious jokes in class... definately go!
He stole Christmas.

He's a great professor and is really enthusiastic about the course.  It's useful to stay for lectures because of the quizzes (easy 3 pts) and you get to learn a lot too.  Once he chased someone who left the lecture right after the quiz, so I guess he's pretty funny.  His exams get progressively harder but he curved the final so it was all good.

Lectures are boring and participation is graded with "Top Hat." Attendance not necessarily needed. Tests are alright. She reads off the ppt's, all ppt's are on blackboard. The lab was always ahead of lectures which was annoying. Extra credit available. Just review ppt's and find her old tests. Not a lot of work to get a good grade!
easy class, interesting, very understandable
No Comments

He is actually a terrible prof. All of the graded things were online and so NOBODY went to the lectures and so he added in class exams. His lectures are on NOTHING. He talks about his life and nothing pertaining to Sociology. If he continues with online tests I would actually recommend getting Dennis so you don't have to go to lecture.

I would not suggest this to students are not willing to put in time and effort. He will offer as much help as you are willing to take. I was too shy to discuss in class and come meet with him about my grade and this truly pulled my grade down. Leaves plenty of feedback and you can tell he wants his students to succeed.

He is an alright professor, mandatory to go to class because he uses an I- clicker. He tends to ramble a lot and his tests are a bit difficult. But he can be very helpful if you go to his office hours, overall it is an interesting class with alot of information and reading is required. It is an easy B but you really got to work hard to get that A.
A terrible professor!! she doesn't care about students AT ALL she has no heart and annoying voice. AVOID AT ALL COSTS

He is one of the best professors I had; this doesn't mean he is easy... but he is full of knowledge. I took him on IT 223 and even though it was hard and painful... I actually learn a lot with him, so I enrolled this semester in IT366. He is full of knowledge.if you want an easy "A" think twice taking him because you would really need to work hard.

Loves to teach...sometimes a little bit too much to handle at 9am. Definitely wants her students to do well, as long as effort is put in. I would strongly reccomend going to class because test questions often involve details from in class videos. Reading the book is also helpful. Go to discussion groups too because you earn 20 bonus points!

don't take him.  he's a real nice guy, i think i might like him outside the classroom, but his lectures are unhelpful, tests difficult.  i had to learn out of the book, even though i went to class.  he could work on the lectures
Good Luck on the Test.

I am not a science person but this class was amazing!  She is very funny, all lectures are online, and there are many opportunities to get extra credit.  Don't buy the textbook, the lectures and lecture notes are online.  I would definitely recommend taking this class!

The professor was one of the best at U of T St. George. A dedicated virologist with extensive knowledge. He also encouraged students to work hard for the future. He is those type of prof who really wants you to succeed in your life!

Good teacher, very interesting.  Film clips and current events really break up the monotony of the usual class lectures.  Test are usually based on power points, but quizes are from book and very hard.

This was an good class. Whitbourne did a great job at making a 9am class worth getting up and going to. It was a very easy class and with extra credit opportunities is almost impossible not to get an A in. It sparked my interest in psychology and I was only taking it as an elective. Definitely take this class.

The math isnt that hard, but the tests are fairly meticulous, but multiple choice! He is great guy, and will provide you with whatever help you need if you go to class.  a little confusing in class, and he has a habit of showing up late and letting the class leave anywhere between 10 and 30 minutes early every day.

The course was really interesting! Tepperman is a very engaging lecturer, and although his presentations are at times scattered, I listened the whole way through. I just wish there was another method of evaluation... An essay, and more tutorials perhaps.

Professor Hylton is none too helpful or pleasant. Overall disrespect for students learning a completely new subject. The "lectures" are a joke, she just rewrites content out of the textbook. However, if you do the homework mindfully and diligently, and go to recitation you will pass.

It depends of tA. T here aren't a lot of points and the hw, discussions, papers, labs are all graded by the tA and there is no rubric. I got a rough grader compared to my peers so I had to pull my weight in this intro level class. Some tests are difficult but you get an optional one at the end. I thought Moloumby was entertaining.
Great Professor, all information presented in class helped pass the tests without really having to study. Attending the lectures is vital to not having to study for hours on the material.
She is the cutest professor EVER! Her hair bounces when she walks. And her twins are adorable. The class was really easy too.

This is NOT an easy course. But if people actually DO the suggested homework, they wouldn't have so much trouble in the course. You'll be fine if you put some EFFORT into the course. That's why you hear about people complaning this course is hard because they don't even bother to do the suggested homework at the least.

Mr.Everett was the best he explained everything clearly, gave mulptiple examples, and gave students a outline on how to write the paper. All you have to do is follow the outline and you will get a decent grade. Mr. Everett also helps students if they as for it and his test as well as reading quizzes are simple if you study. Overall he was  great.

She's very nice and highly enthusiastic for a 9AM, but lacks clarity at some points. Some TAs aren't helpful either. Tests can be tricky, so come to every lecture (with printed notes!), do the textbook readings, and keep up with quizzes. 20pts extra credit for discussions is a plus. Get LearnSmart!!
So cute you just wanna hug him!  Umm...chem is fun, eh? ;)

The class requires some work but nothing over the top. She knows her stuff (after all, she is a C.P.A) but she is not cut out to be a teacher. Classes are ok. Tests are easy, quizzes are mild. Study guide that comes with the book is much better help than any groups that you might form.

I adore him. He's a little arrogant, but heck if I was a professor of Biology and I wrote books about biochemical warfare, I would be too. I think he's very clear and teaches Bio the best way possible. Best bio teacher I've ever had. I'm gonna miss him! I wish he'll be my bio prof in the future! :)
She is the worst teach. Talks/yells down to her students.  Her grading is very unfair and doesnt know what she is teaching half of the time.  If you want to pass DO NOT take this class with her.
na

As an earlier rater said, her class would be a headache. I don't know how some people managed to pay attention in her class! she's shouldn't be a professor in a 100 level class with 300 level expectation. I read some misleading rated comments and took her, and tht was a big mistake :(
makes class interesting, though you must go...

If you pay attention in lecture, discussion, and keep up with the assignments you'll pass no problem. Participation is in the form of i-Clicker. He moves pretty quickly through the lectures so be prepared. Read the book. READ THE BOOK. Sometimes he pulls test questions from the book. If you can keep up and ask for help, you're golden.
Throughout my four years at U of T, I have never met a professor as demeaning and biased as Tepperman.  If he likes you, you're set (as another member wrote).  If not, you're screwed.
ehhh

With respect to humanity, Cook is an extremely pleasant and grandpa-esque little man. I did enjoy his anecdotes and his comments. What I didn't enjoy, however, was his poor teaching. This class stressed me out beyond belief because I hadn't the slightest clue of what was going on. Avoid him if you can.

The exams are extremely hard, not enough time to finish the exam. Most of the question she brings from every where, text book, lecture and lab. She thinks this is a graduate class. You think management is easy, wait till you take this class. Her exams are hardest exams ever I had. Good luck!!!

Not as bad of as professor as people make her out to be. I was nervous when I took her last semester but she turned out to be a great teacher. Simple rule: if you're confused go ask her and she is more than happy to help you learn.
he looks like he is part of the sons of anarchy. first day of class I was shocked when I saw him. his exams are very hard and impossible to pass other than that just don't take him

Fondufe is an amazing professor, her tests are directly from the powerpoints so no need to buy the book. Come to class, she likes to give i clicker quiz from time to time. Taking notes in class makes powerpoint more understandable and sometime there few questions on test from the lecture which aren't include on the powerpoint.
extremely boring. I went to only 3 classes but still did fine.
He's a really poor prof....

poor, poor teacher. He just puts random examples on the board, solves them himself and doesn't explain how or when to use the equation. Math was always fun and enjoyable for me until this guy. Very unhelpful. Doesn't look at emails. Just don't take 127 with him.

The only way to do well in this class is to memorize EVERY single peice of information on the PowerPoints which are around 80-90 slides, and if you don't know everything on all three of them you will not get an A. I will not take her again because she refused to consider an 89.72 an A-... she will not be there for you at the end of the semester
He is really fare in person, but he is certainly out to get you on the exams.  If you email him and tell him you need a certain grade for your major he will reconsider you grade.

Horrible professor!!! Do not take this class!! He wants to purposely ruin your life!!  He makes your entire semester misreble.  He is rude, evil and just a plain nasty person.  GMU needs to get rid of him as soon as possible!
Good course, great professor.

Dr. Sacher is one of the sweetest ladies, but this class was a drag.  She tries so hard to make it interesting, but it just not.  BUT it is a requirement so if u must take it, take it with her.  And i agree with the previous comment, DEFINATELY choose your group members wisely!!

He tends to ramble in his lectures & students spent most of the class time talking about their(mildly relevant)lives/interests. Show up 2 classes before the tests, he gives study guides w/ all the questions on them.He's really nice and eager to work with you.As long as you show up enough for face recognition and do the study guides,you'll get an A.
very entertaining and helpful. he wants everyone to do well.

I learned nothing, the class was easy but it was almost not worth taking. I loved the Lab part but Largen is a poor lecturer, she goes off on tangents and doesn't cover much of the required material. But you are still going to be tested on it. The exams are long and middle school questions are phrased in college format, spelling errors everywhere.

He's nice and funny but he's not great. He's better off teaching calc theory than basic calc. There are only 4 total grades - 3 exams and homework. You can redo homework a million times but Wiley is annoying. TAs were a lot more helpful. Go to reviews and SIs. He does not respond to email.
Very fair and gives you plenty of opportunities to pass, provided you are doing all of the work and reading and going to class.

She is a really good teacher and is helpful! The nice thing about her is she puts the notes online so I never went to class except for the tests and quizzes.  As long as you do the study guides for the tests and go over it you will do fine on the tests.
Love her
She thinks too highly of herself and even though her class was easy to get an A in, she talked too much about herself and she puts on too much makeup.

She's the best! Don't buy the textbook, its completely not necessary. Just study the powerpoints and study guides (the answers to which are on her website). It's okay to miss a few i-clicker questions due to absences... and still get an A+

Prof. Hylton is without a doubt the most miserable professor in SOM.  Her TA's do all the actual teaching.  She talks way too fast, shows ZERO interest in students, doesn't reply to emails, and has a overall total lack of respect for others.  Unless you are one of the people who naturally understands accounting...AVOID her at all costs!

He is a nice older man who sound a little like James Earl Jones.  He definitely knows the material and can very easily be understood.  His class is very easy, so long as you go, take notes, or read before exams.  There were no assignments other than your journal/notebook. He does ramble a little which can be boring, but I recommend him.

Pretty much like 110. Class isn't too tough. Lab is a lot of work and can be a pain, but it's not too tough. Her lectures can be interesting depending on the topic. She's such a nice person. Take her! Def the best way to get your lab requirement!
Very helpful professor. Exams are hard though. You'll learn a lot, but you need to be prepared.
Boring but easy. Gives alot of extra credit!!!
Not a very helpful professor, very frustrating class.

She is the sweetest, funniest, and most helpful science teacher that I had ever had! Recommend her if science is not your thing. Lab is not hard but time-consuming. The materials are basic of other sciences so it's not hard. Do the study guide and EC opportunities than you'll get an A!

BEST teacher i've ever had, dont take this class with anyone else! she's so genuine and loves all of her students. she accepts late assignments. regardless of what she says you're going to need to know the main terms from the book for the midterm and final, it'll help you out a lot.
loved this class take 4 tests but she drops the lowest score and very easy 100 points from 10 question online quizzes that you can just google the answers to
nice prof..tests are too hard.. corny jokes, laughs at them herself.. oh yeh the voice has gotta go :(

His lecture only consists of reading vocab definitions. He takes off points on mistakes on HW, but he has a lot of errors on his works and he doesn't even know it. He needs a makeover in his teaching style. He is very rude and unprofessional. Little does he know he can learn from students too. His lectures are good for nothing on the real job.

Tammy's class was a breeze for me. If you do the readings and take notes and study for tests you should do well. No writing needed, but multiples choice tests. Random mini-quizzes in class make it a good idea to go to them. Dropping lowest grades is allowed. Good glass and prof. overall.

soc101 is an enlightening course.  i feel i'm learning a lot of a relevent material in the course, and it's certainly changing my perspective on society.  i wish it would focus more on primary teachings, rather than sec., but it's still a good soc. intro
